meanings.definition: A flowing together of two or more streams.
meanings.sent1: The conflux of rivers created a wide, powerful current.
meanings.sent2: The conflux of streams formed a larger river.
meanings.sent3: At the conflux of the two rivers, the fish seemed to have a party.
meanings.sent4: The conflux of ideas in the brainstorming session led to a flood of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The conflux of colors in the sunset painted the sky in a beautiful blend.

meanings.definition: A meeting or gathering at a specific point.
meanings.sent1: The conflux of friends at the park was a joyful occasion.
meanings.sent2: The conflux of people at the concert made it a lively event.
meanings.sent3: The conflux of birds on the tree branch looked like a crowded meeting.
meanings.sent4: The conflux of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The conflux of students in the cafeteria created a bustling atmosphere.
